page.title: 02ABERDEEN HARBOUR
page.content: The intrinsic nature of Aberdeen Harbour has dramatically altered over the past 20 years.From being a major fishing and minor cargo port it has metamorphosed into the major oil supply port of Europe.During the past 20 years the number of ships using the harbour has increased fivefold.Most of the boats using the harbour now are Oil Supply boats,'Standbye' boats, seismic survey vessels and Royal Navy warships and craft.There are still fishing trawlers but greatly reduced in numbers and part of the new fish market is no longer used.Regularily seen is the familiar sight of the pale blue and white P.O. ferry the 'ST CLAIR' which sails up to the Shetland Isles.The quays have also been transformed, most have oil tanks or oil service depots located on them now replacing the traditional fish houses.
